com.yantra.api.ycp.workflow

Interface invokeUE

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCPApi, YIFApi

    public interface invokeUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document invokeUE(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The invokeUE invokes a named User Exit implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • invokeUE

        org.w3c.dom.Document invokeUE(YFSEnvironment env,
                              org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                       throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                              java.rmi.RemoteException

        The invokeUE invokes a named User Exit implementation. This API serves as an entry point to invoking User Exits using a transaction Id and a User Exit name.

        It is worth noting here that this API entry point only has the capability to invoke User Exits that can take a YFSEnvironment instance AND an input XML document instance.

        This API's entry point to invoking a named UE is to be used ONLY for the following :
        1. A UE that takes an Environment and an input XML document pair
        2. A UE which necessarily returns an output XML document
        In cases where the input is as mentioned above but the output is of a datatype that is anything other than an XML Document, an exception will be thrown.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API serves as an entry point to invoke named User Exits with a valid transaction id and name.

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions:
        The requested event handlers are invoked.

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        XML Document Object containing the output of the User Exit or null (when the User Exit is not implemented).
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException
